intro: Corydalis cava var. scabricaulis, commonly known as the rough-stemmed corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems covered in a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Native to regions of Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its unique botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
